csw:Record.dct:abstract: The Soil Water Index (SWI) Static Layer collection provides static masks and ancillary files that aid in the analysis of the daily SWI, 10-daily SWI or SWI Time Series products. These include (i) a DGG file to find Discrete Global Grid cell corresponding to a given location, (ii) a tropical Forest Mask (FM), (iii) a Topographic Complexity (TC) mask, a (iv) Wetland Fraction (WF) mask and (iv) Correlation Information (CI) that shows the correlation with Global Land Data Assimilation (GLDAS) models.
csw:Record.dc:description: The Soil Water Index (SWI) Static Layer collection provides static masks and ancillary files that aid in the analysis of the daily SWI, 10-daily SWI or SWI Time Series products. These include (i) a DGG file to find Discrete Global Grid cell corresponding to a given location, (ii) a tropical Forest Mask (FM), (iii) a Topographic Complexity (TC) mask, a (iv) Wetland Fraction (WF) mask and (iv) Correlation Information (CI) that shows the correlation with Global Land Data Assimilation (GLDAS) models.
csw:Record.dc:source: The SWI_TS product is a reformatting of the SWI daily product into a time series format which makes it easier to perform local, time series based analysis without having to download and convert data for the whole globe. The time series data is provided on a Discrete Global Grid (DGG) with a grid point spacing of 12.5 km. This grid contains a total of 3,264,391 points of which 839,826 are over land areas. This grid has the advantage of reducing the data volume of the product while not loosing any information. This is the case because the SWI image product is oversampled to a 0.1° grid from this DGG and would contain 1,814,400 points over land.
